meanings.definition: an opening in a sponge through which water is expelled
meanings.sent1: The oscules on the sponge help it release water.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the oscules to understand how sponges filter water.
meanings.sent3: The curious fish peeked into the oscules of the sponge, wondering what was inside.
meanings.sent4: The oscules of the sponge acted like tiny fountains, spraying water into the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The oscules of the sponge looked like little mouths, eagerly spitting out water.

meanings.definition: to expel water through an opening in a sponge
meanings.sent1: The sponge oscules water to maintain its internal balance.
meanings.sent2: She carefully oscules the sponge to keep it clean and healthy.
meanings.sent3: The sponge suddenly oscules water, surprising everyone around.
meanings.sent4: He oscules the sponge gently, making sure not to harm its delicate structure.
meanings.sent5: The sponge oscules water rhythmically, like a tiny pump in the sea.
